page.title: 06FARMING 1
page.content: Living on a farm is always tiring though perhaps the worst time, but most rewarding , is Spring lambing. I am expected to help, and this means up at half past six to go round the sheep and check for any emergencies.Then into the pens with the sheep and off to milk the cows. After that I might manage to get some breakfast before getting back to the sheep and separating the ewes that have lambed into the hill field. Finally, I get to relax by going to school . The best part about living on the farm is the peace and quiet , except, of course , when I race up and down in the Leyland tractor .But the isolation also means that you can get bored.I feel cut off from my friends . I know when I leave school I won't stay on the farm:it's too much hard work.
